originalTitle: Third round of Russia-Ukraine talks starts in Geneva as strikes continue
title: Hope for Peace! Grown-Ups Talk to Stop Fighting Far Away
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends all across Africa! Your kid-friendly news reporter is here, and I have something important to share with you today. Sometimes, grown-ups in different countries have big disagreements, and sometimes these disagreements can lead to fighting, which we call a war. It’s a very sad thing when countries fight.

Big Grown-Ups Meet to Talk Peace

Right now, in a city far, far away called Geneva, some very important grown-ups are meeting. These grown-ups are from two countries called Russia and Ukraine. They have been having a big, big fight, and many people are sad because of it.

These special grown-ups are called 'negotiators.' That's a fancy word for people who talk for their country. They are meeting for the third time, which means they have tried to talk two times before. This is like when you and your friend have a disagreement, and a teacher or a grown-up helps you both talk about it to find a solution.

They are trying to find a way to stop the fighting. It’s a very important job, because when countries fight, many people get hurt, and homes and schools can be broken. Everyone wants the fighting to stop so people can be safe and happy again.

What is a 'War' Anyway?

A war is when two countries fight using soldiers and big machines, instead of just talking about their problems. It makes many people very, very sad. Homes are not safe, and sometimes kids cannot go to school.

Nobody likes war. We all wish for peace, which means everyone is safe, happy, and living together without fighting. We know in Africa how important peace is, because we have seen many times how much better life is when everyone is at peace.

Did you know? The word 'peace' is one of the most important words in the world! People in every country wish for peace.

Meeting in a Special City

The grown-ups are meeting in a beautiful city called Geneva. Geneva is in a country called Switzerland. It's a special place because it's neutral, which means it doesn't pick sides in the fight. This makes it a good place for everyone to feel safe and talk openly.

Imagine if you and a friend had an argument, and you met in a friend's house who was fair to both of you. That's a bit like Geneva! It's far away from where the fighting is happening, so everyone can focus on talking.

Did you know? Switzerland is famous for its delicious chocolates and very old, beautiful clocks!

Even If It's Far, It Matters To Us!

You might be thinking, "Russia and Ukraine are so far from Africa, why does this news matter to me?" Well, my friends, peace in one part of the world can help make the whole world a better place.

When there is fighting far away, sometimes it can make things more expensive for everyone, even for us here in Africa. For example, some foods or important things we need might come from those countries, or it might be harder to get them.

Also, when one part of our big world family is hurting, we all feel it. People in Africa, our leaders and your families, care deeply about peace everywhere. We want all children, no matter where they live, to be safe, to go to school, and to play happily without fear.

Did you know? There is a very big group of countries called the United Nations. They have their main office in New York, but they also have a big office in Geneva! The United Nations works very hard to bring peace and help to countries all over the world.

Talking is Hard, But We Keep Trying

The grown-ups who are talking know it's not easy. The news says that people are not sure if this meeting will fix everything right away. It's like a very big, complicated puzzle that takes a lot of time and effort to solve.

But the most important thing is that they are trying! They are still talking. Even if it's hard, talking is always better than fighting. Another country, the USA, helped to get these talks started, showing that many countries want to see peace.

We must always have hope that peace will come. Even when things are difficult, we should never give up on trying to find a peaceful way forward.

Did you know? Talking is often the best way to solve problems, even big ones! It's how we learn to share toys, play fair, and be good friends.

What Can We Do for Peace?

So, my young friends, while these grown-ups are working hard far away, what can we do here in Africa? We can do our part every day!

We can be kind to our friends and family. We can share our toys and listen to each other. When we have a disagreement, we can try to talk about it with kind words, just like the grown-ups are doing in Geneva. Every little act of kindness and peace you do helps make our world a better, happier place.

Let's all keep hoping and wishing for peace for Russia and Ukraine, and for everyone, everywhere! Thank you for listening, and remember to always be kind!
summary: Important grown-ups from Russia and Ukraine are meeting in a special city called Geneva for the third time to talk about stopping a big fight, hoping to bring peace so everyone can be safe and happy again.
whyMatters: This news matters because when countries fight, it makes many people sad and can affect everyone, even kids in Africa, by making things harder or more expensive. When grown-ups talk for peace, it helps make the whole world safer and happier for all children.

content: England winger Bukayo Saka commits his future to Premier League leaders Arsenal by signing a new five-year deal.

title: 'We created fire' - Forest boss Pereira on Marinakis reunion
